adjectives.description: wonderworthy (comparative more wonderworthy, superlative most wonderworthy)

entries.meaning: Worthy of wonder, amazement, admiration, or awe; worthy of being admired or of holding status as a wonder.
examples: [...] it was possible for these [Homeric] hymns to be disfigured by so many large additions.” Niebuhr described the Prolegomena in 1827 as “those wonderworthy investigations in which the higher branch of criticism reacht [sic] its perfection.
